alert.note: Alert for Bradley; Calhoun; Cleveland; Dallas; Ouachita (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 4:06AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Bradley, southern Cleveland, northern Calhoun, southeastern Dallas and northeastern Ouachita Counties through 445 AM CDT... At 405 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles northwest of Fordyce to near Thornton to Bearden. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warren... Fordyce... Rison... Hampton... Bearden... Kingsland... Thornton... Harrell... Ellisville... Harlow... Hampton Municipal Airport... Hebron... Highland Industrial Park... Weeks... Mt Elba... Tipton... Marks Mill State Park... Toledo... Lanark... Herbine... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 AM CDT for southeastern and southwestern Arkansas.
